name: Qugale
address: 1788 Sheepshead Bay Rd, Brooklyn, NY 11235, USA

reviews.text: misho thank you‚Ä¶
The restaurant is excellent and the food is perfect! The stuff, service, quality, everything is amazing. Definitely recommend it
no service at all! They brought it and forgot that you had guests, every time you had to wait for the waitress! We won‚Äôt be back

Visited this place recently and it was one of best experiences on Sheapshead Bay. Food was delicious stuff Super friendly. Will definitely come back again and recommend everyone to visit if you want to try Georgian cuisine and see real Georgian hospitality. Thank you Qugale

The food was outrageously bad in no way close to Georgian cuisine.everything was overpriced. What a pity that they throw ashes in your eyes and assure you that the taste and quality are at a high level.
2-3 years ago it was a place to go, not anymore! Food tastes nothing like Georgian!!! Very disappointed.

We did our baby shower here. Amazing food, super friendly staff. Thank you for making this evening so special . I will recommend this place to my friends
Amazing wine !!!highly recommended !!
Food was ok, the place was empty, and bit  pricey. The waiter was not too helpful, and was disappearing somewhere.

Do not recommend this place. Old soviet type diner with tacky dark maroon tone, very bad food, sour face Karen servers and blown up prices. Came here yesterday‚Ä¶Where to start. The food was as plain and tasted like you would get at the local supermarket, supermarket may be better tasting. The salad was chunks of barely cut HARD vegetables. Lamb khinkali was decent/good. Hachapurri was terrible. Wine that‚Äôs not on their menu was red and ice cold, why???

The service is the worst part. Any questions on the menu were met with animosity and I am Russian speaking and frequently eat Georgian food. I can‚Äôt imagine being an American and how I‚Äôd be treated here. We got dirty looks and nobody came over to serve us. We would‚Äôve ordered more but nobody cared to come to us. Then they blasted the music although we were the only people there. That was our cue that we are being kicked out.

Atmosphere is laughable. Room #1 is a red cave live basement with chalk graffiti from visitors/friends. Room #2 is where the men go to smoke

So many better places for Georgian food.
·Éô·Éê·Éò·Éê
Good Service, excellent stuff, food amazing!
Nice
Absolutely recommend for Georgian cuisine! Great food, friendly staff, amazing environment!

Unbelievable food, most hospitable service and the atmosphere is very warm and welcoming. Recommend any one Georgian or not to come try this food. Definitely try the khinkali‚Ä¶ might be the best in the city

Decided to try a new restaurant in the area and regret it. The service was horrible‚Äî the waitress was sitting in the back with the owner the whole time smoking cigarettes. I might as well have gone to the kitchen and asked for my food. Food was fine. Don‚Äôt pay attention to prices on the menu because they‚Äôll charge you whatever they want anyway and when you ask them about the completely different number on your bill vs the one on the menu, they argue with you. The owner personally came up to me to tell me how expensive meat is these days. It was empty inside for a reason‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

this place is incredible! Food is absolutely delicious! An absolute gem. Food was delivered timely manner. It‚Äôs always hard to choose Georgian restaurant while being in NYC but now I do have favorite one. Our server was great and friendly. (Tato‚Äôs) definitely give it a try if you love Georgian food.
Excellent!! Love this place ü´∂
Amazing place, wonderful stuff! Food was excellent! I recommend to visit this place to everybody! Thank you guys for this Love!
It's not my type of place some people might enjoy I didn't it isn't for me

I recently dined at Qugale, and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The ambiance was inviting with its warm, rustic decor and cozy lighting. The staff was not only attentive but also incredibly knowledgeable about the menu.

Now, let's talk about the food ‚Äì it was nothing short of exquisite. Each dish was a culinary masterpiece, bursting with flavors that left my taste buds in awe. The fusion of ingredients was both creative and harmonious, making every bite a delight.

I highly recommend trying their signature dish, the Qugale Special. It's a true representation of their culinary prowess. For dessert, the chocolate lava cake was a sweet ending to a perfect meal.

Qugale truly stands out in terms of both food and service. If you're looking for a memorable dining experience, don't miss the opportunity to visit this gem of a restaurant. It's a place where food becomes art, and every visit promises a gastronomic adventure.
Highly recommend!

As a Georgian, I'm 100% in love with this Georgian restaurant and all the dishes served, super tasty!! üòçüí´‚ú®

The service is very friendly, atmosphere is cozy and most importantly, it's clean!

Will definitely visit many more times ü§©‚ÄºÔ∏è
Bruh , do you think you have tried the best kninkali in NY? If you want to get the real taste of Georgian cuisine, you must come here, the best prices, the best atmosphere, highly recommend ü§ôüèª
Best food in Brooklyn!!
Everything was excellent.  I look forward to dining there again and again!

The best Georgian restaurantüá¨üá™‚ô•Ô∏èVery nice staff and especially food was perfect, I never tasted like this beforeüòç
highly recommendedüíØ‚ô•Ô∏è

This was a gem to find!! We were very hungry and I have never had Georgian food before. The food was delicious! The service was wonderful! The owner greeted us and gifted us champagne when he learned we are here for first time. ‚ô•Ô∏è We felt very welcome and our server did her best to suggest us traditional Georgian dishes and advise us on portion sizes.
We left full of delicious Georgian food and very pleased with service! Thank you, guys! ‚ô•Ô∏è

Very tasty food, quickly prepared.
There were ants on the table, hot, the fan was off, the furniture is old, which needs to be renovated. The service fee is already included in the bill, which made us disappointed.

Amazing food. Amazing music. The environment is really fantastic. They have heaters that mitigate the winter cold. They also provide you with cozy blankets in the case you can't handle the cold. Waiters were really nice. Totally recommend this place.

Great interesting Georgian restaurant with a garden inside and live music sometimes. The food was good, it was cozy. The service was nice. The only thing I didn't like was that people were smoking in the garden dining area. I think this is‚Ä¶

This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! Delicious dishes and beautiful presentation. Best Khachapuri in Brooklyn. I recommend to everyone! I would like to come back here again and again. üîù‚Ä¶

I order adjarski khachapuri every 2 weeks, but this time they made it twice smaller then usually for the same price without even warning.
It was a pickup, so I took a box and realized it was very light. I stepped outside, opened the box with baby khachapuri for $20! I came back to get an explanation, so I‚Äôve been told  ‚Äúprices went up sorry‚Äù. I could get the whole pie for this amount of money.
Next time will order somewhere else.

By the way, you can see on a picture how little cheese they put on it.
Very disappointed.
Very tasty, way sooo delicious. Great service, quick prep and taste and smell reminds me my childhood‚Ä¶ so nostalgic. Thanks a lot and wish ably the best!

if you want to taste, outentic Georgian food Qugale is a place, stuff is super friendly and all food is very tasty, they have great soundsystem and music selection, for sure will visit as soon as I can and will try all foods from menu ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Delicious food amazing atmosphere great service will definitely come back
very cool place!  cozy, clean, beautiful!  the food is delicious!  will be back !!!!!

Horrible place. Overpriced + food is nothing special. We have had better Georgian food in the neighborhood. The waitress was nice and apologetic when we told her there was a problem with our food. The owner or the manager of the place is a‚Ä¶

Looking for something to eat, we stumbled across this place. The waitress was so nice. She went over the culture and spices of the region, she explained the different specialties and ingredients. She offered advice, everything was delicious. The back garden is super cute. The manager greeted us and was friendly. What a hidden gem! We will be back.

If you decide to visit this restaurant please take my friendly advice and try to park as close as you can possibly find a spot. The reason: portions are enormous and the food is so good and tasty that you'll have hard time stopping eating.
Service and hospitality are matching the food. To say it in one word - The Georgians!

Went there with friends on friday night. Tried lamb chops -Challagachi was dry- probably overmarinated or overcooked. same thing about fried chicken. Serve regular tap watter-unfiltered. They didn't have everything listed in the menu.‚Ä¶

We had a great time at Qugale! It is the new Georgian restaurant in the Sheepshead Bay area. The food was fresh and very delicious! Everybody was friendly and polite. We really enjoyed it. There is one room indoors and one outdoors.

I had a chance to dine with my friend in this authentic Georgian restaurant the other day. We ordered pkhali assortment, khinkali, fried potatoes and ribs. Everything was fresh and super delicious.  Will definitely go again.
Amazing Georgian restaurant! Food is five stars, hospitality on the top-level and outdoor space is very chill. Sorry, no photos of the food because it‚Äôs all gone by now. Will definitely be back.

After reading some good reviews about this place, I was looking forward to tasting some of their good food. I was very disappointed. Most of the thing I ordered was very very bad.
Hinkali had hair inside. The chicken in garlic sauce was horrible, the chicken was extremely dry and over cooked, the sauce was more like a soup and didn‚Äôt even have garlic in it. Was later told that they had prepared it earlier in the morning and served it to me in the evening.
The liver cubes were so over cooked that it was more like a crunchy meat cracker. Was told that a lot of people complained about this, why not just take it if the menu of the chef doesn‚Äôt know how to make it ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Aside from that the only think I did enjoy was the salad, very delicious.
Most probably will not go there again.

Excellent food and service. I had the lamb stew (Chanakhi) it was excellent with baked bread laid over it. My wife had the chicken in cream sauce (Shkmeruli) also excellent garlic sauce. The mushroom soup was delicious. Please try this place.

One waitress is not enough to serve a lot of people coming to the restaurant on Sunday evening, this causes delays. I believe there's only one cook at the kitchen too, this causes overcooked, oversalted or too spicy dishes. Unlike my previous visit, this one was absolutely disappointing.
If you want to enjoy great delicious Georgian cuisine, Qugale restaurant is right for you. Not only they got yummy food but also nice atmosphere and great service! Can‚Äôt wait to come back again!

10 out of 10. Georgian Authentic food and live music will create a great memory of your day. Great service and great management. I would love to visit this restaurant frequently. The best Georgian restaurant in NYC!!! üëåüëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª‚Ä¶

As much as I want to support Georgian business, have to admit that the food is extremely overpriced, service not present.

Also please, please  change your Playlist, it is really upsetting to listen to those tasteless Georgian remakes of foreign pop songs.
We had delicious Ajaruli  khachapuri there. Waitress and owner were very nice and friendly.  Spacious and quiet environment.  We will definitely come again.  Thank you Qugale.
The best place to taste real delicious Georgian food , pleasant atmosphere, friendly staff, excellent service. Just love to go chill out there and of course enjoy amazing music üëç
Delicious Georgian food, great service, and such warm welcoming owners. This is the place to go if it‚Äôs your first time trying Georgian food or if you love it and are looking for a place to go.
Came with a friend on Saturday night, ordered shish kebab, he ordered khachaouri and salad.  Waited 30 minutes for a salad (super small size) we waited another 15-20 minutes and we just left.
Omg this is delicious ü§§ really good place and atmosphere. Thank you‚Ä¶

It's a great Georgian restaurant in town with exquisite food and signature Georgian dishes where. I even travel for this amazing khachapuri from Manhattan from time to time. Absolutely love this place!

I recommend to visit and get authentic Georgian healthy and testy foods with no large damage of your budget. If you are collector of folk place in your life experience, Qugale is place for eyes, ears and taste pleasures with olfactory waiters service
